content:
ChangePasswordDesigner Class

In this Article

Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the ChangePassword Web server control.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ChangePasswordDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ComponentDesigner
  • HtmlControlDesigner
  • System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner
  • ChangePasswordDesigner

Remarks

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the ChangePassword control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

Constructors summary

ChangePasswordDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the ChangePasswordDesigner class.

Properties summary

ActionLists

Gets the action list collection for this designer.
AllowResize

Specifies whether the ChangePasswordDesigner control allows resizing.
AutoFormats

Gets the collection of automatic format schemes that will be displayed in the Auto Format dialog box.
RenderOuterTable

Specifies whether the ChangePasswordDesigner control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
TemplateGroups

Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the control that is associated with this designer.
UsePreviewControl

Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Methods summary

GetDesignTimeHtml()

Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
GetDesignTimeHtml(DesignerRegionCollection)

Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(EditableDesignerRegion)

Gets the persisted form of the current template of the associated control.
GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(Exception)

Gets the markup that renders to a placeholder containing information about the error that occurred while attempting to create or render the associated control at design time.
Initialize(IComponent)

Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the Properties grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.
SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(EditableDesignerRegion,String)

Sets the value of a template of the associated control.

Constructors

  • ChangePasswordDesigner()

    Initializes a new instance of the ChangePasswordDesigner class.

    public ChangePasswordDesigner ();

    Remarks

    The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the ChangePasswordDesigner class when it creates the associated ChangePassword control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Properties

  • ActionLists

    Gets the action list collection for this designer.

    public override System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection ActionLists { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerActionListCollection

      The DesignerActionListCollection associated with this designer.

    Remarks

    The ActionLists property creates a DesignerActionList object for the ChangePasswordDesigner object, adds the DesignerActionList object to the DesignerActionListCollection object obtained from the base property, and then returns this collection.

  • AllowResize

    Specifies whether the ChangePasswordDesigner control allows resizing.

    public override bool AllowResize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the control allows resizing; otherwise, false.

  • AutoFormats

    Gets the collection of automatic format schemes that will be displayed in the Auto Format dialog box.

    public override System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection AutoFormats { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerAutoFormatCollection

      A DesignerAutoFormatCollection that contains the predefined schemes for the ChangePassword.

    Remarks

    The elements of the DesignerAutoFormatCollection object are derived from the DesignerAutoFormat class and are populated from internally defined XML-encoded constant strings.

  • RenderOuterTable

    Specifies whether the ChangePasswordDesigner control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.

    public bool RenderOuterTable { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    The ChangePasswordDesigner control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup. You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to true. Removing the outer table gives you greater flexibility in how you apply CSS rules to the markup that is rendered by the control.

  • TemplateGroups

    Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the control that is associated with this designer.

    public override System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection TemplateGroups { get; }

    Property Value

    • TemplateGroupCollection

      A TemplateGroupCollection containing an element for each template in the associated ChangePassword.

    Remarks

    The TemplateGroups property constructs a TemplateGroupCollection object and populates it with the collection returned by the base property. It then adds a TemplateGroup object for each of the templates (ChangePasswordTemplate and SuccessTemplate) of the associated ChangePassword control.

  • UsePreviewControl

    Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

    protected override bool UsePreviewControl { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Always true.

    Remarks

    Because the UsePreviewControl property is always true, the designer uses a View control that contains a temporary copy of the associated ChangePassword control to generate the design-time markup. The View control does not affect any persistence for the ChangePassword. If the UsePreviewControl property were overridden to return false, the designer would use the associated ChangePassword itself to generate the design-time markup.

Methods

  • GetDesignTimeHtml()

    Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

    public override string GetDesignTimeHtml ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String containing the markup used to render the ChangePassword at design time.

    Remarks

    The GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the mode of the associated ChangePassword control, which can be a copy, to the current mode of the actual control. Next, it forces the child controls to be recreated, and then calls the base method to generate the markup. If an error occurs, the GetDesignTimeHtml calls the GetErrorDesignTimeHtml method to generate the markup for a placeholder.

  • GetDesignTimeHtml(DesignerRegionCollection)

    Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.

    public override string GetDesignTimeHtml (System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions);

    Parameters

    • regions
      DesignerRegionCollection

      A DesignerRegionCollection to which a definition of the current view of the associated control has been added.

    Returns

    • String

      A String containing the markup used to render the ChangePassword at design time.

    Remarks

    The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the GetDesignTimeHtml() method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the ChangePassword control. It also adds a DesignerRegion object to the regions parameter that describes the current view of the ChangePassword control.

  • GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(EditableDesignerRegion)

    Gets the persisted form of the current template of the associated control.

    public override string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region);

    Parameters

    • region
      EditableDesignerRegion

      An EditableDesignerRegion that is not used by this GetEditableDesignerRegionContent override.

    Returns

    • String

      A String containing the persisted form of the current template of the associated ChangePassword.

    Remarks

    The GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method serializes the current template (the ChangePasswordTemplate or SuccessTemplate property) of the ChangePassword control to its persisted form, which is a String object of markup text. This persisted form consists of the serialized child controls appended together.

  • GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(Exception)

    Gets the markup that renders to a placeholder containing information about the error that occurred while attempting to create or render the associated control at design time.

    protected override string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (Exception e);

    Parameters

    • e
      Exception

      The Exception that was thrown while creating or rendering the associated control.

    Returns

    • String

      The markup for the placeholder that contains information about the specified exception.

    Remarks

    The placeholder contains the type and control names, an error message, and the Message property that is associated with the e parameter.

  • Initialize(IComponent)

    Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

    public override void Initialize (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);

    Parameters

    • component
      IComponent

      A ChangePassword, which implements IComponent.

    Remarks

    The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the ChangePassword control. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.

    The component parameter is the ChangePassword control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the control specified by component.

  • PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

    Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the Properties grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

    protected override void PreFilterProperties (System.Collections.IDictionary properties);

    Parameters

    • properties
      IDictionary

      A collection implementing the IDictionary of the added and shadowed properties.

    Remarks

    Control designers use methods derived from the PreFilterProperties method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add or remove properties from the Properties grid.

    For the ChangePassword control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the Browsable attribute to false for properties that do not apply to templates (removes them from the Properties grid) when a user template has been defined.

  • SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(EditableDesignerRegion,String)

    Sets the value of a template of the associated control.

    public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);

    Parameters

    • region
      EditableDesignerRegion

      The EditableDesignerRegion to set content for.

    • content
      String

      A String containing a persisted control or template.

    Remarks

    The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method sets an editable region in a designer to a control or template that is specified in its persisted form by the content parameter.
